timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -271,3 +271,12 @@ MongoDB collection has the special field ``_id``. The connector tries to follow
 .. note::
 
     Unfortunately, there is no way to represent ``_id`` fields more fancy like ``55b151633864d6438c61a9ce``.
+
+Limitations
+-----------
+
+The following operations are not supported:
+
+- Deleting data with :doc:`/sql/delete`, :doc:`/sql/drop-table`, or similar
+  operations
+- Updating data, which is generally not supported by Presto

replies.bodyText:
Is that link a good or a bad example? E.g the section title there should not repeat the name of the connector. Also it does not talk about updating data. So I am not sure what you want me to change in this PR. And maybe fix up that same section in the the sql server connector docs to be more like this section.
I am also not aware of the specific limitations so if you can enumerate the SQL commands that wont work that might help (provided we want to list them here)
replies.author: mosabua

replies.bodyText: Also in the sql server docs the mapping is in the limitations section. That is also wrong.
replies.author: mosabua

replies.bodyText:
E.g the section title there should not repeat the name of the connector.

good catch

Also it does not talk about updating data.

because it does not make sense to document a global limitation in each connector's docs, does it?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
Well.. I think we need a section somewhere that says that Presto does not support updating data in general. Where would we put that?
And then maybe a connector overview page that speaks about this as well or refers to it. I can work on that.
And for now I guess I can remove it here .. although it is confusing for users as you can see from the ticket that initiated this work.
replies.author: mosabua

replies.bodyText: Connector overview and other updates have to wait..
replies.author: mosabua

timeline.bodyText:
DROP TABLE is supported in MongoDB connector.
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/37c74ad15f5f0c9c770c2aa491e49ffe5146d4b1/presto-mongodb/src/main/java/io/prestosql/plugin/mongodb/MongoMetadata.java#L159-L165
timeline.author: ebyhr
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -271,3 +271,12 @@ MongoDB collection has the special field ``_id``. The connector tries to follow
 .. note::
 
     Unfortunately, there is no way to represent ``_id`` fields more fancy like ``55b151633864d6438c61a9ce``.
+
+Limitations
+-----------
+
+The following operations are not supported:
+
+- Deleting data with :doc:`/sql/delete`, :doc:`/sql/drop-table`, or similar

replies.bodyText: oh ...  does someone have a reliable list of what is and is not working or should I look at the code myself to get this documented correctly?
replies.author: mosabua

replies.bodyText: @mosabua I think no one has such list and we need to look at the code. As you already know, "Override Methods.." in IntelliJ provides us missing statement types in each connector.
replies.author: ebyhr

replies.bodyText: I updated the list a bit based on some poking around ..
